Created an attachment (id=48579)
Schema to reproduce

Can reproduce with 3.2 when opening the attached schema. The code recurs in Schema#setName().
PDE team, please verify that this happens again and route back if it turns out that the problem is in forms.
Mike, can you please take a look?

Reproduced using 3.3 M7. I am getting CCEs.

The schema is corrupt.  The element reference is not wrapped in a compositor

e.g. incorrect

<complexType>
...
   <element ref="enablement" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/>
...
</complexType>

e.g. correct

<complexType>
...
   <sequence>
      <element ref="enablement" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/>
   </sequence>
...
</complexType>

In any event, The editor should not fail so horribly.  I'll see what I can do.

Fixed.  Patch attached.

Target:  3.3 RC1
Patch:   patch_136135_2007-05-10_14-07.txt

The schema model was incorrectly processing "element" elements as valid 
children of "complexType" elements and then later assuming the elements parent
was a compositor ("choice", "sequence", "group", "all" elements).

Work Done:

* Do not process "element" elements when they are children of "complexType"
  elements
  -> The invalid mark-up will not be loaded into the Schema model and will not
     be reflected in the UI
  -> When making any changes to the schema, the invalid mark-up will be
     discarded on save

Wassim, could you please review my patch?
Released the patch to keep the train moving.

Mike, I am reopening the bug.

It breaks the DTD approximations of all schemas.

Patch:  patch_136135_2007-05-11_11-27.txt

processCompositorChild called both on compositors themselves when processing 
their children and complex types when processing their children
"element" a legitimate child in the former case; but, not in the latter case.

Work Done:

* Do not process "element" elements when their parent is a complex type

Verified that the DTD approximation is now OK again and that the schema opens fine in the editor.

Released patch to keep the train moving.
